title-group.article-title: Automobile Air Bag Inflator Based on Combustion of Methane-Oxygen Mixture

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2000 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A new fast combustion infiator based on the reactions of methane-oxygen mixtures has been developed. The performance of this infiator was evaluated in terms of pressure-time relationships inside the infiator and in a receiving tank simulating an air bag and by assessing the temperature-time relationship in the tank. In order to develop this infiator, several critical issues were studied, including stoichiometry, initial mixture pressure and extreme ambient conditions. Other design parameters such as burst disk thickness and type, ignition device, tank purging gas, concentration of carbon monoxide, severity of temperature in the tank, and the infiator size were investigated and optimized. To simulate the behavior of this infiator, a theoretical and integrated model was developed. The experimental results made at different conditions were found to be in agreement with the model. The performance of this infiator was compared with that of sodium azide and strategies for its implementation in an actual air bag system were formulated.
